title: Decision Trees
content:
Module 5, Lesson 4: Decision Trees

The Hook

This lesson covers Decision Trees as part of the Supervised Learning module in the Learn AI course. Mastery of this topic is essential for building a comprehensive understanding of the subject area.

The Concept

In Decision Trees, you will explore the foundational ideas, practical techniques, and real-world applications that make this area of study both relevant and actionable. Each concept has been carefully selected to build on prior knowledge and prepare you for more advanced topics.

The Illustration

Understanding Decision Trees means being able to apply these principles in professional contexts. You will encounter scenarios, case studies, and examples drawn from real industry practice, helping you translate theory into competence.

Summary

You have completed Decision Trees (Supervised Learning, Lesson 4). Proceed to the quiz to test your understanding, then continue to the next lesson to build further expertise.

quiz.question: What does overfitting mean in a supervised learning model?
options: The model performs well on training data but poorly on new data
The model takes too long to train

quiz.question: Which metric is commonly used to evaluate classification models?
What distinguishes supervised learning from unsupervised learning?
options: Supervised learning uses labelled training data
Supervised learning clusters similar data points

quiz.question: Which algorithm is best suited for predicting a continuous value?
What is the purpose of a train-test split?
options: To evaluate model performance on unseen data
